commentary.line: So, that's all we have from this game. Hopefully, you will join us tomorrow for the game between Rajasthan and Mumbai in Ahmedabad. It should be a good contest. On behalf of Krishna, Raju, Sriram, Bharat and my co-commentators, Ramakrishnan and Pradeep, this is Sidhant Maheshwari, signing off! See you tomorrow.
Let's take a look at some of the tweets from this game:
@G_Rajaraman: Clinical is the word for @SunRisers show tonight; solid batting to back up incisive bowling but @BLRTweets can blame themselves too
@sidmallya: Well played #HYD...shame to start our home games with a loss,but still a long way to go so onwards and upwards from here! #BLR #BLRvHYD #IPL
@bhogleharsha: Virat Kohli has reason to be upset with his quick bowlers. That was poor and indisciplined. #WaitingforStarc. #PepsiIPL
@TheVijayMallya: Very well done and congratulations HYD. Below par performance by BLR at home. Both batting and bowling let BLR down. The better team won.
@holdingwilley: Other than #DEL and #MUM, all other #IPL teams have won at least 1 of 2 matches played so far!

Warner: 'What a performance by the bowlers there! The bowlers did a fantastic job to bring us back. The spell from Boult and Bhuvi was special. We said at the start of the tournament that we pride ourselves on our fielding and that's 50 percent of the game. So, happy that we did well there. Credit to the bowlers, they gave us a nice total to chase and we knew that anything below 200 can be chased here. Dhawan was also very good but he played with a different tempo today. This win is massive, especially winning here in Bangalore. Bring on our home games .'
David Warner is the Man of the Match for his blazing fifty

Kohli: 'We were just not good enough with the ball. We were 15-20 runs short. I also didn't stay till the end and AB was going great, but got out in the end. We didn't hit the button today. We gave a lot of freebies early on. We need to figure out and review our performance today. The bowlers should know that they were off their game and weren't good today. With the bat, we got close to 170. Maybe, it was a 180-185 wicket, but we definitely need to improve our bowling in the next game. Adam Milne should be fit next game and Starc should also be coming to India soon. Their return will boost our bowling attack. So, hopefully we will get our bowling right next time. We need to learn from our mistakes and hopefully, we can come back strongly.'

The credit also has to go to Hyderabad' bowlers for maintaining unremitting control. Karn Sharma bowled parsimoniously and Ravi Bopara picked up the key wicket of Kohli. Trent Boult showed his mettle in the slog overs by taking three wickets in a single over. Only AB de Villiers and Kohli were able to essay fine knocks for the home team. In the end, it didn't prove to be enough on a flat pitch.

David Warner explored every nook and corner of the ground to crack a fifty as Hyderabad registered a convincing win. Warner was in imperious touch and just annihilated Bangalore's attack. In particular, Harshal Patel and Varun Aaron came in for some severe punishment. Warner then reached his fifty in a mere 24 balls. At the other end of the spectrum, Shikhar Dhawan played with composure and once Warner was dismissed, he strung together a fine partnership with KL Rahul to steer the visitors home. Bangalore's bowlers bowled all over the place and it became difficult for Virat Kohli to set a field.

17.2   Aaron to Rahul, SIX, poor ball again, a full toss on the pads, Rahul just uses his wrists to flick it over the deep backward square leg fence for a maximum to win the game. HYD win by 8 wickets, a comprehensive win in the end and BLR have been defeated in their own backyard
de Villiers is off the field and is being treated by the physio
17.1   Aaron to Rahul, FOUR, backs away this time and he lofts this one to the right of the fielder at mid-off and the ball runs away to the fence. HYD just need a solitary run to win now
Varun Aaron [3.0-0-26-0] is back into the attack
16.6   Abu Nechim to Dhawan, no run, yorker well outside off, Dhawan opens the face of the bat and squeezes it out to short third man
Another free-hit coming up

16.6   Abu Nechim to Dhawan, no ball, SIX, Dhawan hits the free-hit for a maximum! Wait a minute, it is another no-ball from Nechim. It was full and angled across off, Dhawan goes right across and swings it over the deep mid-wicket fence for a six, what power from Dhawan there and what great use of the wrists, Dhawan reaches his fifty as well with that six

16.6   Abu Nechim to Rahul, no ball, 1 run, short of length delivery on middle, Rahul looks to work it through the on-side, but ends up getting a leading edge that rolls away to mid-off, the batsmen take a quick single, Nechim has overstepped as well
16.5   Abu Nechim to Dhawan, 1 run, on the pads once again, Dhawan tucks it away behind square on the on-side for a single

16.4   Abu Nechim to Rahul, 1 run, angling in on the stumps, Rahul works it away to mid-wicket, de Villiers from mid-wicket runs to his right and tries to stop the ball with his foot, but ends up stepping on the ball and twists his ankle. He was looking in some agony there. Hopefully it's not a serious injury

16.4   Abu Nechim to Rahul, 5 wides, poor bowling from Nechim once again, it was well down the leg-side, Karthik dives across to his right but fails to make a clean stop, he can only manage to parry it towards the fine leg fence, Kohli is not happy with the effort there

16.3   Abu Nechim to Rahul, 2 runs, not a great piece of bowling here as Nechim bowls another one on a length and outside off, Rahul drives it wide of long-off and good running ensures that they come back for the second

16.2   Abu Nechim to Dhawan, 1 run, 50 of the partnership comes up, it was a yorker outside off, Dhawan goes across and squeezes it out to short cover and sets off, the fielder runs in, picks the ball and underarms it at the striker's end, but Rahul was well in

16.1   Abu Nechim to Rahul, 1 run, Kohli is feeling the pain as Rahul drives this half volley outside off straight to him at short cover. Kohli parried it towards mid-off, but his expressions show that it did hit him hard

15.6   Chahal to Rahul, 1 run, googly to end his spell, Rahul was hurried into the shot as he ends up pushing at it uppishly, but luckily for him it went through the vacant mid-on region, the batsmen take a single. The ball might have stopped on Rahul there
15.5   Chahal to Dhawan, 1 run, Dhawan comes down the track and lofts this one to long-on, the ball goes on the bounce to the fielder
Dhawan is down on the pitch as he takes the bail to clear the mud in his spikes. A little delay while he does that
15.4   Chahal to Rahul, 1 run, Rahul knocks this one to cover and sets off, de Villiers was quick to fire in the throw at the striker's end, but Dhawan had made his ground

15.3   Chahal to Dhawan, 1 run, Chahal tosses one up on off, Dhawan premeditates as he goes for the reverse lap, doesn't get it fine and the batsmen take a single as the ball goes on the bounce to short third man
15.2   Chahal to Rahul, 1 run, Rahul takes a step forward once again and intentionally chips this flighted delivery outside off over the bowler's head for a single

15.1   Chahal to Rahul, no run, comes down the track and looks to go over wide long-on, but he completely mistimes it off the inside half of the bat to mid-wicket, where Kohli dives to his left and prevents the single
Yuzvendra Chahal [3.0-0-23-2] is back into the attack

14.6   Abu Nechim to Dhawan, no run, Dhawan goes across once again and this time Nechim gets it to angle away from over the wicket, he goes for the cut, but ends up chopping it towards point. The length was not there for him to play that shot

14.5   Abu Nechim to Dhawan, SIX, that's a super strike from Dhawan! It was short and on off from round the wicket, Dhawan goes across and pulls it handsomely over the deep square leg fence. He did that with sheer ease
14.4   Abu Nechim to Dhawan, no run, back of a length delivery angled across off, Dhawan stands tall and punches it to extra cover
14.3   Abu Nechim to Rahul, leg byes, 1 run, another one on the pads, Rahul fails to flick it fine, the ball rolls away off the pad into the on-side and the batsmen take a leg bye
14.2   Abu Nechim to Rahul, FOUR, short and down the leg-side, poor ball from Nechim, Rahul stays back and just helps it fine, collects four

14.1   Abu Nechim to Rahul, 2 runs, short of length delivery angling in on off, Rahul was cramped for room there as he went for the pull, but luckily he got it to the left of the fielder at mid-wicket, the batsmen take two before the fielder from long-on runs to his right and cuts it off
Abu Nechim [2.0-0-9-0] is back into the attack
Time for the strategic timeout

13.6   Abbott to Dhawan, no run, Dhawan goes slightly across to this delivery angled across off, he opens the face of the bat and pushes it to the right of point, he wanted the single there but Rahul sends him back
13.5   Abbott to Rahul, 1 run, in the channel just outside off, Dhawan goes slightly across and bunts it down to long-on to get off strike

13.4   Abbott to Dhawan, 1 run, full delivery slightly wide outside off, Dhawan went chasing after it and gets an outside edge that was in the air for a little while, but falls well short of the fielder at third man
13.3   Abbott to Dhawan, no run, length ball angling away just outside off, Dhawan drives it back to the bowler off the inside half of the bat
13.2   Abbott to Rahul, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, Rahul leans forward and drives it to the left of mid-off, the batsmen cross over
13.2   Abbott to Rahul, wide, another one down the leg-side, Abbott has lost his radar here, second wide as Rahul fails to glance it fine
13.2   Abbott to Rahul, wide, down the leg-side, Rahul fails to tickle it fine, called a wide
13.1   Abbott to Rahul, no run, fuller delivery on middle stump line, Rahul stays back and clips it to short mid-wicket, who dives to his right and prevents the single
Sean Abbott [1.0-0-16-0] is back into the attack
12.6   Aaron to Rahul, 1 run, again bowls this one on the pads, Rahul tucks it away backward of square leg, he will keep the strike

12.5   Aaron to Dhawan, 1 run, low full toss on the pads, Aaron is lucky to not have given four for that. It was a poor ball from him and Dhawan can only help it towards deep square leg for just a run
12.4   Aaron to Dhawan, no run, angled across off, Dhawan defends to short extra cover

12.3   Aaron to Rahul, 1 run, almost chopped on once again! Rahul has been lucky on two occasions now. It was just short of a good length and there was not enough width on offer as Rahul went for the cut, the ball takes the inside edge and goes past the stumps, the batsmen take another single
12.3   Aaron to Rahul, wide, bumper down the leg-side, Rahul was happy to leave that, the height on that one was too much for the umpire

12.2   Aaron to Dhawan, 1 run, touch fuller and angling away outside off, Dhawan went for the drive on the up, he gets it off the outside half of the bat and the ball runs away to third man, who fumbles but luckily, the ball doesn't roll away to the fence
12.1   Aaron to Rahul, 1 run, short of length delivery on the pads, Rahul glances it off the pads behind square on the leg-side
Varun Aaron [2.0-0-20-0] is back into the attack

11.6   Chahal to Rahul, 1 run, beaten in the flight, Rahul was down the track and was not to the pitch of the ball, but he went through with the loft and luckily for him, he just about clears the bowler, who was jumping up to take the catch. The batsmen take a single as the ball rolls away to long-off
11.5   Chahal to Dhawan, 1 run, touch flatter and on off, Dhawan backs away a touch and punches it down to long-off
11.4   Chahal to Rahul, 1 run, googly on the stumps, Rahul waits for it and wrists it down to long-on for a run
11.3   Chahal to Rahul, no run, slows this one around off, Rahul leans forward and pushes it to short cover
11.2   Chahal to Rahul, FOUR, that's a good shot from Rahul, it was tossed up on the stumps, Rahul charges down the track and lofts it over the bowler's head for a boundary
11.1   Chahal to Dhawan, 1 run, comes down the track and drives this full ball down to long-off
10.6   Sammy to Rahul, FOUR, what a shot! It was banged in short from Sammy and Rahul was quick to latch onto it, he pulls it over a leaping mid-wicket and the ball runs away to the fence in no time
10.5   Sammy to Dhawan, 1 run, length delivery outside off, Dhawan opens the face of the bat and drives uppishly, but in the gap towards sweeper cover

10.4   Sammy to Rahul, 1 run, Rahul sneaks in a quick single, it was fuller and on off and middle, Rahul drives it to mid-on and sets off, he had to go around Sammy as the throw from mid-on came at the non-striker's end, but he was well in

10.3   Sammy to Dhawan, 1 run, just short of a good length and just outside off, Dhawan bunts it uppishly past a diving Sammy, the batsmen take a single as the ball rolls away down towards long-off, it wasn't that far away from Sammy's left hand though
Sammy comes round the wicket now

10.2   Sammy to Rahul, 1 run, almost chopped on! It was just short of a good length and around off, Rahul looks to run it down to third man with an angled bat, gets an inside edge and the ball runs past the leg stump and the batsmen sneak in a single
10.1   Sammy to Rahul, 2 runs, back of a length delivery angling in on the pads, Rahul works it away through mid-wicket and gets back for the second
A slip is in place for the new man Rahul
Darren Sammy [1.0-0-8-0] is back into the attack
9.6   Chahal to Rahul, 1 run, tossed up and on off, Rahul works it down towards long-on for a single
Lokesh Rahul, right handed bat, comes to the crease

9.5   Chahal to Williamson, out Stumped!! Williamson falls cheaply! This was tossed up and skidded through after pitching, Williamson lunged forward on the sweep, dragged his foot out in the process. He misses and Karthik is quick to whip the bails off. Williamson was looking to get back, but it's too late in the day, 2nd wicket for Chahal. Williamson st D Karthik b Chahal 5(9)
Chahal to Williamson, THATS OUT!! Stumped!!
Appeal for a stumping. D Karthik looks confident. Williamson had dragged his foot out and he's well short. Should be the second wicket for BLR
9.4   Chahal to Dhawan, 1 run, Chahal gives this one more air, driven down towards long-off for a single
9.3   Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, slower and just outside off, punched off the back foot and towards deep cover for a single
9.2   Chahal to Dhawan, 1 run, flighted delivery and on off, driven to the left of the bowler. He makes a half stop and can't save the single
9.1   Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, tossed up and wider outside off, eased down towards long-off for a single
8.6   Harshal Patel to Williamson, 1 run, on a length and on the stumps, worked away past square leg for a single
8.5   Harshal Patel to Dhawan, 1 run, short of a length and just outside off, Dhawan swivels across and pulls it to deep mid-wicket
8.4   Harshal Patel to Williamson, 1 run, once again drifting onto Williamson's pads, flicked away behind square on the on-side for a single
8.3   Harshal Patel to Williamson, no run, back of a length and just outside off, Williamson stands tall and punches it towards mid-off
8.2   Harshal Patel to Williamson, leg byes, FOUR, poor ball from Patel, angles one onto Williamson's pads, he looks to flick and misses, the ball clips the pads and races away to the fence
A slip is in place now
8.1   Harshal Patel to Williamson, no run, back of a length and just outside off, punched straight to the fielder at point
Harshal Patel [1.0-0-20-0] is back into the attack
7.6   Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, the googly from Chahal, but Williamson spots it early and nudges it behind point for a single
A slip is in place
Kane Williamson, right handed bat, comes to the crease

7.5   Chahal to Warner, out Lbw!! Chahal has struck! BLR needed this one badly! This was the leg-break from Chahal, tossed up on off and spins back into Warner, he was on his knees as he aimed for a slog sweep, misses and is struck on the back-pad. The impact was around middle and would have gone on to hit the stumps. Illingworth is quick to raise his finger. Warner isn't happy but he has to go. Warner lbw b Chahal 57(27) [4s-6 6s-4]
Chahal to Warner, THATS OUT!! Lbw!!
7.4   Chahal to Dhawan, 1 run, tossed up slower and wider outside off, Dhawan comes down the track and drives it towards long-off for a single
7.3   Chahal to Warner, 1 run, flatter and on the stumps, pulled away behind square on the on-side for a single
7.2   Chahal to Warner, SIX, Warner is in a fiery mood today! Fraction short and on the leg-stump line, Warner goes down and hoicks it high and over backward square leg for a maximum
7.1   Chahal to Dhawan, 1 run, flighted and just outside off, worked towards mid-wicket for a single
Yuzvendra Chahal, right-arm leg break, comes into the attack
6.6   Sammy to Dhawan, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, eased down towards long-on for a single
6.5   Sammy to Dhawan, FOUR, lovely shot, overpitched and well outside off, Dhawan leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and punches it through extra cover for a boundary
6.4   Sammy to Warner, 1 run, 50 for Warner, equals his fastest fifty in IPLs, on a good length and just outside off, punched towards long-off for a single
6.3   Sammy to Dhawan, 1 run, full and angling into Dhawan, worked towards mid-on for a single
6.2   Sammy to Dhawan, no run, back of a length and well outside off, sliced straight to Mandeep at backward point
Sammy changes to round the wicket
6.1   Sammy to Warner, 1 run, Sammy goes wide outside off, Warner chases after that and slaps it to deep cover for a single
Darren Sammy, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Time for a strategic break
5.6   Abu Nechim to Dhawan, no run, width on offer from Nechim, cracked straight to the fielder at backward point
5.5   Abu Nechim to Warner, 1 run, too short from Nechim, helped away behind square on the on-side for a single
5.4   Abu Nechim to Warner, no run, on a good length and just outside off, Warner drives and finds AB at extra cover
5.3   Abu Nechim to Warner, SIX, that's easy pickings for Warner, fraction short and well outside off, swatted away over mid-on, the ball went sailing over the ropes for a maximum
5.2   Abu Nechim to Warner, no run, Nechim keeps it full and just outside off, Warner goes hard on the drive and mistimes it back at the bowler
5.1   Abu Nechim to Warner, no run, fuller length delivery and angling into Warner, no room for the batsman to free his arms, driven straight to mid-on
4.6   Aaron to Dhawan, no run, much better from Aaron, on a good length and angling away from outside off, Dhawan went chasing after that and is beaten
Warner wants a change of bat. Wonder why?
4.5   Aaron to Warner, 1 run, the slower bouncer from Aaron, Warner had to wait onto the pull, gets a single past mid-wicket
4.4   Aaron to Warner, no run, full and just outside off, driven straight to AB at cover-point
4.3   Aaron to Warner, SIX, this is poor from Aaron, goes short as Warner backed away, cracked away up and over point, goes over the ropes on the full
4.2   Aaron to Warner, FOUR, too short from Aaron, Warner rocks back and pulls it to the left of mid-wicket, the fielder gets a hand onto it, but the ball still rolls away to the fence
4.1   Aaron to Warner, FOUR, superbly played! On a good length and on the off-stump channel, Warner clears his front leg and goes back over the bowler's head, one bounce and over the ropes
3.6   Abu Nechim to Dhawan, no run, fuller length delivery and well outside off, Dhawan drives it crisply but straight to the fielder at cover-point
3.5   Abu Nechim to Dhawan, no run, short of a length and just outside off, Dhawan shuffles across and punches it back at the bowler
Slip moves across towards mid-wicket. Dhawan backs away at the last moment and Nechim has to abort his run-up
3.4   Abu Nechim to Warner, 1 run, full and following Warner as he backed away slightly, pushed in front of mid-on for a single
3.3   Abu Nechim to Warner, no run, short and just outside off, stayed a td low, Warner was on his haunches as he mistimed the pull towards mid-wicket
3.2   Abu Nechim to Dhawan, 1 run, length ball and on Dhawan's pads, tucked past square leg for a single
3.1   Abu Nechim to Dhawan, no run, short of a length and angling across the left-hander, punched straight to the fielder at point
Abu Nechim, right-arm medium, comes into the attack
2.6   Aaron to Warner, no run, short of a length and on the off-stump channel, Warner pushes it towards mid-off
2.5   Aaron to Warner, no run, very full and just outside off, Warner takes it on the full and gets a toe-edge towards cover
2.4   Aaron to Dhawan, 1 run, Aaron gets away with another wide full-toss, drives to the right of AB at extra cover, he dives and makes a half-stop, saves three runs for his team
2.3   Aaron to Dhawan, no run, that's much better from Aaron, the inswinging yorker, shapes back into Dhawan, he falls over and just about manages to dig it out
More discussions between Kohli and his bowlers. Warner suggests he needs a towel, there's a break in play
2.2   Aaron to Dhawan, FOUR, another wide full-toss from Aaron, is the ball slipping off their hands? Drilled past cover for another boundary, all too easy for HYD so far
Some more sawdust onto the bowler's landing area
2.1   Aaron to Dhawan, no run, short of a length and on the stumps, Dhawan looks to defend and is hit high on the splice
Varun Aaron, right-arm fast, comes into the attack

1.6   Harshal Patel to Warner, SIX, 20 from the over, this is magnificent batting from Warner, fraction short and well outside off, Warner swivels across and pulls it high and over deep mid-wicket for a maximum
1.5   Harshal Patel to Warner, FOUR, this is poor bowling from Patel, wide full-toss, Warner gets forward and thumps it past AB at extra cover for a boundary
1.4   Harshal Patel to Warner, no run, short of a length and angling back into Warner, he plays a half-arm jab towards mid-wicket
1.4   Harshal Patel to Warner, wide, Patel sprays one miles outside off, called as a wide
Patel changes to round the wicket

1.3   Harshal Patel to Warner, FOUR, that's smashed! Short of a length and just outside off, Warner rocks back and flat-bats it past the bowler, no need to run for those, this has been a blistering start for HYD
1.2   Harshal Patel to Warner, FOUR, wrong line and wrong length from Patel, short and on Warner's hips, he hops across and helps it over short fine for another boundary
1.1   Harshal Patel to Dhawan, 1 run, too straight from Patel, worked away past mid-wicket for a single
Harshal Patel, right-arm medium, comes into the attack
0.6   Abbott to Dhawan, 1 run, 16 from the first over, length ball and on Dhawan's pads, nudged away behind square on the on-side for a single
0.5   Abbott to Dhawan, FOUR, more runs for Dhawan! This one came back with the angle, ends up drifting onto Dhawan's pads, whipped away past mid-wicket for another boundary
Abbott changes to round the wicket

0.4   Abbott to Dhawan, FOUR, lovely shot, on a good length and in that channel outside off, Dhawan leans forward, meets the ball on top of the bounce and caresses it through extra cover for a boundary
0.3   Abbott to Warner, 1 run, fuller length delivery and swinging back into Warner, driven to the left of mid-off for a quick single
0.2   Abbott to Warner, 2 runs, tad fuller and swinging back into Warner, worked away past mid-wicket for a couple of runs
0.1   Abbott to Warner, FOUR, that's a freebie first up! Juicy full toss from Abbott, Warner leans forward and caresses it through extra cover for a boundary
Warner and Dhawan are at the crease. Warner is on strike. Abbott will open the attack
Welcome back.. Can BLR defend 166? Sean Abbott has the new ball in his hand. One slip in place

Bopara: "It was nice to get the wickets tonight. That was a nice catch by the skipper. We are happy with 166. The ball was really wet out there and it was slipping out of the hand. We obviously want to get off to a flier, if we get to 50-60 in the first six overs, I think we'd be in a good position."

Gayle: "It's only two games, I don't mind wearing it (Orange Cap) at the moment though. Hopefully I can keep it as long as possible, if not till the end of the tournament. It's a good wicket and I tried to play through the line. The new ball tends to do a bit."

Virat Kohli looked to steady the innings. But Ravi Bopara with clever changes of pace prised out Kohli as well as Mandeep Singh. Trent Boult too made his mark by giving a good account of himself in the end overs and took three wickets. de Villiers then checked in a few shots to bring some respectability to the total. Barring Karn Sharma dropping a caught and bowled chance to give Kohli a reprieve, the fielding too was sharp. For instance, David Warner shone brightly by taking a splendid catch to dismiss Mandeep. The odd ball is stopping on the batsman, but the visitors should back themselves to chase down the target.

AB de Villiers played sparkling shots to lift Bangalore to a decent total. In fact, they were tied in knots by a disciplined effort from the Hyderabad' bowlers. It was Chris Gayle, who played a few monstrous strokes to give the home team a rousing start. However, Praveen Kumar put the brakes on the scoring rate by dismissing Gayle.
With five wickets in hand and two overs to go, who would have thought that HYD would bowl out BLR. Great comeback by them.

19.5   Bhuvneshwar to Abu Nechim, out Bowled!! This is an even better yorker from Bhuvneshwar. Nechim couldn't put bat on ball after making a bit of room and it crashed into the base of middle stump. Abu Nechim b Bhuvneshwar 4(2) [4s-1]
Bhuvneshwar to Abu Nechim, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!
19.4   Bhuvneshwar to Chahal, 1 run, full and outside off stump, Chahal drives and gets it on the outside half of the bat, the ball rolls to backward point, Chahal takes off and makes his ground
Yuzvendra Chahal, right handed bat, comes to the crease

19.3   Bhuvneshwar to Aaron, out Bowled!! That is exactly what the bowling coach would have wanted at this stage. Great yorker at the base of middle and off. Aaron takes a step towards the bowler and tries to squeeze it out, but misses and the ball shatters the stumps. Aaron b Bhuvneshwar 6(3) [6s-1]
Bhuvneshwar to Aaron, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!

19.2   Bhuvneshwar to Aaron, SIX, wow! Who said only ABdV can tonk it for BLR at this stage? This is a slower ball, but Aaron has come down the track, waited for the ball and lofted it handsomely over long-off
19.1   Bhuvneshwar to Aaron, no run, full and wide outside off stump, Aaron fails to make contact
Bhuvneshwar Kumar [3.0-0-23-0] is back into the attack

18.6   Boult to Abu Nechim, FOUR, these are handy runs for BLR. Full and outside the off stump, Abu Nechim backs away and tries to squeeze it away, he gets it over backward point and short third man and it goes for four
Varun Aaron, right handed bat, comes to the crease

18.5   Boult to Harshal Patel, out Caught by Williamson!! Wow! He's got three wickets in a space of 5 balls. This is a great over from Boult. Patel is cramped for room by this shortish ball, he attempts the pull, but it hits him high on the bat, mid-wicket runs forward and to his left to give Boult his third wicket. Harshal Patel c Williamson b Boult 2(2)
Boult to Harshal Patel, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
18.5   Boult to Harshal Patel, wide, bumper from Boult, left alone, but the umpire doesn't like the height on that one
18.4   Boult to Harshal Patel, 2 runs, short and wide outside off stump, Patel cuts hard, but the fielder at third man does well to run to his right and stop the ball with his right hand
Abu Nechim, right handed bat, comes to the crease

18.3   Boult to Abbott, out Caught by Karn Sharma!! He's on a hat-trick now. Nothing great about this ball. Back of a length and outside off stump, Abbott goes for the pull but slices it straight to cover. Abbott c Karn Sharma b Boult 14(9) [4s-1 6s-1]
Boult to Abbott, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
Harshal Patel, right handed bat, comes to the crease

18.2   Boult to de Villiers, out Caught by Dhawan!! Full and wide outside off stump is the place to bowl to de Villiers when he's looking to go berserk and that's exactly what Boult has done. Massive wicket for HYD at this stage. de Villiers is strong at anything that is close to the stumps, he tries to reach out this time and go over cover, but slices it high in the air, the man at sweeper runs forward and takes an easy catch. End of a good hand from de Villiers. de Villiers c Dhawan b Boult 46(28) [4s-5 6s-2]
Boult to de Villiers, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

18.1   Boult to de Villiers, FOUR, two fielders in the deep have made a mess of it. Kane Williamson running to his left from deep mid-wicket and Rahul running to his right from long-on slide and collide, the ball escapes between both the fielders and goes for four. Low full toss from Boult, de Villiers swings it across the line and gets four more. Good start to the over
Round the wicket
Trent Boult [3.0-0-25-0] is back into the attack

17.6   P Kumar to Abbott, FOUR, this time he makes contact and it's good enough to go for four. Praveen Kumar opts for the widish full ball, Abbott crashes the square-drive hard, the ball beats point and the man at sweeper had no chance. Good over for BLR, 14 came off it
17.5   P Kumar to Abbott, no run, Abbott throws everything at it, but only connects with thin air. Again full and outside off stump, Abbott tries to go over cover but doesn't make contact
17.4   P Kumar to Abbott, 2 runs, very full, driven to long-on. Should have done better with it there as it was in the slot

17.3   P Kumar to Abbott, SIX, that's a friendly ball. Low full toss down the leg-side, Abbott helps it on its way and send it over the long leg boundary. Praveen Kumar couldn't control the ball on that occasion. Probably he was looking for the yorker, but missed it by a big margin
17.2   P Kumar to de Villiers, leg byes, 1 run, almost a yorker, de Villiers takes his front leg out of the way and swings hard, but misses and gets hit on the right leg
17.1   P Kumar to Abbott, leg byes, 1 run, slower ball down the leg-side, Abbott misses the flick, the ball goes off the pad and goes behind square
Praveen Kumar [3.0-0-22-1] is back into the attack

16.6   Bhuvneshwar to de Villiers, FOUR, what, there's no one sweeping on the off-side? Low full toss outside off stump, de Villiers reaches out and crashes the drive through cover-point and moves into the 40s
16.6   Bhuvneshwar to de Villiers, wide, that's a harsh call. That was just inside the line. Widish yorker, de Villiers couldn't reach out

16.4   Bhuvneshwar to de Villiers, 1 run, yorker on the stumps, de Villiers digs it out, Bhuvi jumps to his right and gets a hand on it
16.3   Bhuvneshwar to Abbott, 1 run, low full toss on the stumps, Abbott swings and gets it on the inside half of the bat and it goes to deep square leg
16.2   Bhuvneshwar to Abbott, no run, short of length delivery just outside off stump, Abbott goes for the slog and misses. The ball just goes past the off stump
Looks like Abbott has come out with the wrong gloves. He gets another set and is ready to go now.

16.1   Bhuvneshwar to de Villiers, 1 run, a clean pick-up from Bhuvi would have been interesting. Bhuvneshwar Kumar [2.0-0-14-0] is back into the attack
Sean Abbott, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Time for the strategic break

Full and on the off stump, not quite a yorker, Sammy swings hard looking to go over long-on but misses it completely and the off stump is uprooted. This could make a difference of 10-15 runs to the final score. Sammy b Ashish Reddy 6(9)

15.3   Ashish Reddy to de Villiers, SIX, can't bowl there. Slower ball down the leg-side, de Villiers gets down on one knee and sweeps it over backward square leg and he's connected that very well

15.1   Ashish Reddy to de Villiers, 2 runs, good length delivery on the off stump, de Villiers flicks it to deep mid-wicket

Karn Sharma (4-0-20-1) ends an excellent spell.

14.5   Karn Sharma to de Villiers, no run, down the leg-side, swept fine but straight to short fine leg, a couple of yards either side of the fielder would have been four
14.4   Karn Sharma to Sammy, 1 run, leading edge but there is no one at mid-wicket and Sammy gets lucky. He tried to play towards square leg and got away with the edge

14.1   Karn Sharma to Sammy, 1 run, pushed along the ground to long-off

Shortish slower ball outside off stump, no pace for the batsman to work with, de Villiers goes on the back foot and flat-bats it, he did not time it well, long-on, who was on the edge jumped, took the catch but his back leg landed beyond the boundary line

12.4   Karn Sharma to de Villiers, no run, very full, driven back to the bowler

12.2   Karn Sharma to Sammy, no run, flatter delivery on the leg stump, glanced to short fine

Slower delivery on the stumps, Mandeep looks to flick it through mid-wicket, closes the face of the bat a bit too early, the ball takes the leading edge and goes towards extra-cover, Warner at short cover dives full length to his right and grabs it horizontal to the ground with one-hand. 10.3   Karn Sharma to de Villiers, 1 run, very full, dug out by de Villiers, the fielder at extra-cover dives to his right but the ball goes to long-off
10.2   Karn Sharma to de Villiers, no run, flighted delivery outside off stump, de Villiers drives it to cover

Big cheer from the crowd as AB walks in.

BLR might not mind this wicket actually as it brings AB to the crease. D Karthik c Williamson b Karn Sharma 9(11) [4s-1]
Karn Sharma to D Karthik, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

9.2   P Kumar to Kohli, SIX, he's making a move now! Slower delivery but it goes too full, Kohli picks it early, goes deep in the crease, waits and slogs it over wide long-on. That hit betters Kohli's strike-rate
9.1   P Kumar to Kohli, FOUR, excellent shot from Kohli. He was down the track in a flash, Kumar delivered a length ball in the slot, Kohli lofts it easily over extra-cover

5.5   P Kumar to D Karthik, no run, fullish and outside off stump, defended off the front foot
5.4   P Kumar to D Karthik, no run, short of length delivery on the off stump, defended

Gayle isn't happy with himself. Gayle c Ashish Reddy b P Kumar 21(16) [4s-3 6s-1]
P Kumar to Gayle, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

3.5   Bhuvneshwar to Gayle, no run, Bhuvneshwar bowls this a little fuller and with the shape away, Gayle doesn't want to play at those

3.4   Bhuvneshwar to Gayle, FOUR, too much width on offer and Gayle has smashed that. Shaping away was this good length delivery, it wasn't full enough to draw the batsman forward, Gayle muscles it off the back foot through cover

2.6   Boult to Kohli, wide, down the leg-side, easy call

2.5   Boult to Kohli, no run, hugeee shout for LBW, looked very very close, but not given. HYD can't believe it. Excellent inswinger, Kohli looks to play towards mid-on, misses and gets hit in line with off stump, that looked absolutely plumb as it hit him well below the knee roll. Lucky escape for BLR

2.4   Boult to Kohli, no run, almost knocked him over! Good length delivery swinging back in, Kohli plays completely across the line, the slog looks so ugly but the ball goes over the top of off stump
2.3   Boult to Kohli, no run, full and outside off stump, Kohli tries to squeeze it out but misses
2.2   Boult to Kohli, no run, nicely driven off the front foot, but straight to cover. Bopara fumbles a bit, but they don't take the run
2.2   Boult to Kohli, wide, bowls this inswinger down the leg-side
2.1   Boult to Kohli, no run, inside edge but luckily it hit the pad. Otherwise, it would have crashed into the stumps. Inswinger on the off stump, Kohli looks to drive but gets an edge onto pad
1.6   Bhuvneshwar to Gayle, no run, squared up completely. Gayle was on move, Bhuvneshwar took this away from him and beat him all ends up

1.5   Bhuvneshwar to Gayle, FOUR, what a shot! Nothing wrong with the ball. The big man is in the mood. Gayle advanced and yorked himself, it was an inswinger on the leg stump, Gayle just dug that out, but the thick willow that he has, the ball races away wide of mid-on
1.4   Bhuvneshwar to Kohli, 1 run, opens the face of the bat and dabs this good length delivery to third man
1.3   Bhuvneshwar to Kohli, no run, much wider this time, Kohli defends, the ball literally rockets to backward point. That flew off the bat in no time

1.2   Bhuvneshwar to Kohli, FOUR, excellent shot from the BLR skipper. What a way to get off the mark. Bhuvneshwar lands one on a good length, just a hint of shape away on this one, Kohli leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and drives it nicely to the left of mid-off
1.1   Bhuvneshwar to Kohli, no run, not much of swing on this good length delivery, Kohli defends off the back foot
Bhuvneshwar Kumar, right-arm medium, comes into the attack
Two slips in place for Bhuvi as well
0.6   Boult to Gayle, no run, ends the over with a yorker on the leg stump, Gayle gets across the stumps and just about manages to dig it out, the ball goes straight to short fine leg
0.5   Boult to Gayle, no run, this time Boult drags his length back a bit, great shape away from the left-hander, left alone

0.4   Boult to Gayle, 2 runs, looks like Gayle is going to unsettle the line of the bowler. Boult bowls another outswinger on a fuller length, Gayle loses his shape as he swings hard at it, the ball goes off the outside half of the bat and lands safely at deep cover

0.3   Boult to Gayle, SIX, Boult gets greedy looking for nice swing. he bowls this very full, Gayle swings it straight down the ground and it crashes into the sightscreen. That was a nice hit by Gayle
0.2   Boult to Gayle, no run, beaten! Tentative footwork from Gayle. Nice and full, swinging away outside off stump, Gayle looks to defend but the ball goes past the outside edge
0.2   Boult to Kohli, 2 wides, looking for inswing, Boult sprays one down the leg-side, keeper does well to move to his left and save a few

0.1   Boult to Gayle, 1 run, swing straightaway for Boult. Nice and full and on the off stump line, nice outswing on it as well, Gayle stays in the crease and defends with soft hands, the ball takes the outside edge but goes to the left of second slip, who dives and makes a half-stop
Two slips in place
Gayle and Kohli are at the crease. Gayle is on strike. Boult will open the attack
The players are making their way out to the middle. The countdown begins and here we go!
Teams:
Hyderabad (Playing XI): Shikhar Dhawan, David Warner(c), Kane Williamson, Lokesh Rahul, Naman Ojha(w), Ravi Bopara, Ashish Reddy, Karn Sharma, Praveen Kumar, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Trent Boult
Bangalore (Playing XI): Chris Gayle, Mandeep Singh, Virat Kohli(c), Dinesh Karthik(w), AB de Villiers, Darren Sammy, Sean Abbott, Harshal Patel, Abu Nechim, Varun Aaron, Yuzvendra Chahal
Hyderabad have won the toss and have opted to field

Warner: "We've seen high totals get chased down here. It's a great place to play cricket. I think it could rain, but can't control it. We will bowl first. We've got to take wickets in the first six overs. Kane (Williamson) will bat at No. 3 today. Dale (Steyn) will play later, but he's missing out again tonight."

Kohli: "It was the right start for us as a team. We would like to make some improvement with the bat, the bowlers came back well. Me and Chris (Gayle) have complemented well with the bat before and that is why I decided to open. This time around we've got the right balance. Off the field we are quite easy, it's on the field where we get competitive (taking about his rivalry with Warner). That's mutual respect I guess. We both like to play hard on the pitch. We've got the same XI as the last game."
Toss time folks!
The players are warming up and the toss isn't too far away. Stay tuned folks.
Pitch Conditions: Chinnaswamy Stadium is usually a batting paradise - with short boundaries and high altitude helping the batsmen's cause. Will it stay that way this season as well?

Head-to-Head record: The two teams have met each other 4 times after the change of Hyderabad's management. It's even-stevens with both teams winning twice. One of Hyderabad's victories (in 2013) was secured after a super over.

On the other hand, Hyderabad struggled to cope under extreme weather conditions in Chennai. The bowling - considerd to be their strength - flopped and they became the first team to concede 200+ in this edition of the Indian Premier League. Brendon McCullum also became the first batsman to score a century this season. Hyderabad's decision to leave out Dale Steyn backfired and they were left to repent their call. The batting struggled as well. Some decisions were perplexing, particularly the call to bat Williamson - low down at number six.

Bowling is hitherto considered as BLR's weakness and there were occassions when they came under immense pressure during the game against KOL. The ground fielding was poor and the catching was shoddy. It meant the batsmen needed to come good and fortunately for Virat Kohli's men, Gayle stood up for the occassion. It wasn't the usual Gayle that one is accustomed to. He took his time even as wickets tumbled at the other end, chose the moments to open up, and when he did do, there was no stopping him. Kohli and AB de Villiers got starts, but both were guilty of needless bravado - costing them their wicket. The team management will be hoping for a calmer display from their frontline batsmen.

It's been a hectic start to the tournament and both teams have enjoyed mixed results. While BLR stopped KOL's 10-match winning streak, thanks to a Chris Gayle special, the Hyderabad failed to turn up for their encounter against Chennai at Chepauk.

18:35 Local Time, 13:05 GMT, 18:35 IST: It's the turn of Bengaluru to host its first match of the 8th edition of the Indian Premier League. The day started off brightly, turned into heavy clouds by noon and was followed by an hour of thunder, lightning and heavy rain. Prospect of any play looked bleak at that moment, but three hours before the first ball is to be bowled, rain gave way to bright sunshine and hope. If there's no more rain, we might well have a prompt start. Hello, and a warm welcome to one and all for the 8th match of IPL 2015. It's Bangalore up against Hyderabad.

Preview

A Chris Gayle-inspired Bangalore (BLR) got their Indian Premier League (IPL) 2015 campaign off to a winning start with a three-wicket victory against Kolkata (KOL) at Eden Gardens. The Virat Kohli-led side will be keen on extending the momentum when they take on Hyderabad (HYD) in their first home encounter of the season at the Chinnaswamy stadium on Monday. For HYD, the match provides them an opportunity to get their campaign back on track following a below-par showing against two-time champions Chennai (CHN) at the MA Chidambaram stadium.

Although their bowling effort was not up to the mark, BLR managed to get over the line in their opening match against KOL thanks to a brilliant 96 by Gayle and tail-enders Harshal Patel and Abu Nechim holding their nerves in a close finish. Despite their win, the Bangalore franchise have a few issues to address before taking the field against HYD.

David Warner, as full time captain of HYD, will have a lot on his mind following his team's performance against CHN. Their fielding was poor, they missed multiple run-out chances, the bowling was indisciplined and the batsmen, apart from the skipper, hardly made their presence felt. Warner will want his side to right the wrongs when they take on the hosts.

Venue: M Chimmaswamy stadium, Bengaluru
Date: April 13, 2015
Time: 20:00 IST
Weather: Thunder storms forecast before the start time. Temperatures around 23 degree Celsius.

Bangalore

As far as the eleven for the match is concerned, BLR are unlikely to make any changes based on the performance of only one game. They will, however, want improved performances from most of the players. The bowlers, barring Yuzvendra Chahal and Abu Nechim, went for plenty and will have to up their game against the likes of Shikhar Dhawan, Warner and Co. Amongst the batsmen, too, it was only Gayle and AB de Villiers who managed to hold their own. If the rest of the batsmen play with more discipline and do not get carried away by the occasion, it will serve the team better in the matches to come.

Probable XI: Virat Kohli (c), Chris Gayle, Dinesh Karthik (wk), Mandeep Singh, AB de Villiers, Darren Sammy, Sean Abbott, Harshal Patel, Abu Nechim, Yuzvendra Chahal, Varun Aaron

Hyderabad

HYD might opt against playing two spinners at the Chinnaswamy stadium considering the small boundaries. This means Parvez Rasool could make way for Laxmi Ratan Shukla. Ishant Sharma's poor showing might see him being replaced by Praveen Kumar. But, just as in BLR's case, HYD could also give the side that played against CHN another go to prove themselves.

HYD seemed to have made a few blunders with their batting set-up in the last game. Kane Williamson batted way down the order and was left with too much to do. HYD head coach Tom Moody, skipper Warner and the team think-tank need to work on a better batting order and ensure that quality names make it to the middle earlier.

Probable XI: David Warner (c), Shikhar Dhawan, Kane Williamson, Naman Ojha (wk), Ravi Bopara, Lokesh Rahul, Laxmi Ratan Shukla/Parvez Rasool, Karn Sharma, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Praveen Kumar/Ishant Sharma, Trent Boult

Numbers:

1: The number of sixes Chris Gayle needs to score to become the first with 200 sixes in the IPL. Suresh Raina occupies the second spot with 134 maximums.

1: Dinesh Karthik needs one more dismissal to equal Adam Gilshrist and MS Dhoni for most dismissals by a keeper in IPL. He currently has 66.

Quotes:

I am not going to let composure or complacency get in my game. I am looking forward to another big game back home. We need to continue this momentum and our winning ways: Chris Gayle sends out a warning signal to HYD.

It just shows the depth we have in our team. We have so many experienced bowlers and someone is going to miss out. It was nice to get a nod. Hopefully, I will get more: Trent Boult, on being preferred over Dale Steyn.
Teams:

Hyderabad (From): Shikhar Dhawan, David Warner(c), Lokesh Rahul, Naman Ojha(w), Kane Williamson, Ravi Bopara, Parvez Rasool, Karn Sharma, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Ishant Sharma, Trent Boult, Dale Steyn, Moises Henriques, Ashish Reddy, Ricky Bhui, Chama Milind, Kevin Pietersen, Eoin Morgan, Laxmi Shukla, Praveen Kumar, Hanuma Vihari, Prasanth Padmanabhan, Siddarth Kaul

Bangalore (From): Chris Gayle, Mandeep Singh, Virat Kohli(c), Dinesh Karthik(w), AB de Villiers, Darren Sammy, Sean Abbott, Harshal Patel, Abu Nechim, Varun Aaron, Yuzvendra Chahal, Shishir Bhavane, Jalaj Saxena, Sarfaraz Khan, David Wiese, Nic Maddinson, Ashok Dinda, Vijay Zol, Sandeep Warrier, Yogesh Takawale, Rilee Rossouw, Iqbal Abdulla, Manvinder Bisla, S Badrinath
